alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 1:27PM MDT until further notice by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pocatello has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Idaho... Little Wood River above High Five Creek near Carey affecting Blaine County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pocatello. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Wood River above High Five Creek near Carey. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.9 feet, Near bankfull above Little Wood Reservoir and up Muldoon Creek. Camping sites near the stream`s edge may have water in them. Other creeks and streams in the area may be approaching bankfull. At 5.4 feet, Minor flooding is possible above Little Wood Reservoir and up Muldoon Creek. Camping sites near the stream`s edge may have water in them. Other creeks and streams in the area may experience minor flooding also. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM MDT Friday the stage was 4.6 feet. - The river has been rising above minor flood stage during its peaks each day. The highest stage over the last 24 hours was 5.6 feet. A Warning may be issued if the river remains above flood stage over a longer period of time. Minor flooding of fields and a few back roads is already occurring above Little Wood Reservoir. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 4.9 feet. - Flood stage is 5.4 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. If you observe any flooding, please report your observations to the National Weather Service in Pocatello via phone, email, or social media, when it is safe to do so.
